member.name: T:OxyPlot.Axes.CategoryAxis

member.remarks: The category axis is using the index of the label collection items as coordinates. If you have 5 categories in the Labels collection, the categories will be placed at coordinates 0 to 4. The range of the axis will be from -0.5 to 4.5 (excluding padding).

member.name: T:OxyPlot.Axes.DateTimeAxis

member.remarks: The actual numeric values on the axis are days since 1900/01/01. Use the static ToDouble and ToDateTime to convert numeric values to and from DateTimes. The StringFormat value can be used to force formatting of the axis values "yyyy-MM-dd" shows date "w" or "ww" shows week number "h:mm" shows hours and minutes

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.HorizontalAndVerticalAxisRenderer.GetRotatedAlignments(System.Double,System.Double,OxyPlot.HorizontalAlignment@,OxyPlot.VerticalAlignment@)
member.summary: Gets the alignments given the specified rotation angle.
member.param: The angle of a box to rotate (usually it is label angle).
The axis angle, the original angle belongs to. The Top axis should have 0, next angles are computed clockwise. The angle should be in [-180, 180). (T, R, B, L) is (0, 90, -180, -90).
member.remarks: This method is supposed to compute the alignment of the labels that are put near axis. Because such labels can have different angles, and the axis can have different angles as well, computing the alignment is not straightforward.

member.name: T:OxyPlot.Series.CandleStickAndVolumeSeries
member.summary:
Represents a dual view (candlestick + volume) series for OHLCV bars
Note that to use this series, one *must* define two y-axes, one named "Bars" and the other named "Volume". Typically would set up the volume on StartPosition =0, EndPosition = fraction and for the bar axis StartPosition = fraction + delta, EndPosition = 1.0.
member.remarks: See link

member.name: T:OxyPlot.Series.CandleStickSeries
member.summary:
Represents a "higher performance" ordered OHLC series for candlestick charts
Does the following: - automatically calculates the appropriate bar width based on available screen + # of bars - can render and pan within millions of bars, using a fast approach to indexing in series - convenience methods
This implementation is associated with issue 369.
member.remarks: See also Wikipedia and Matlab documentation.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.Series.CandleStickSeries.minDx
member.summary: The minimum X gap between successive data items

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Series.CandleStickSeries.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Series.CandleStickSeries.IncreasingColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used when the closing value is greater than opening value.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Series.CandleStickSeries.DecreasingColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill color used when the closing value is less than opening value.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Series.CandleStickSeries.CandleWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the bar width in data units (for example if the X axis is date/time based, then should use the difference of DateTimeAxis.ToDouble(date) to indicate the width). By default candlestick series will use 0.80 x the minimum difference in data points.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Series.CandleStickSeries.FindByX(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Fast index of bar where max(bar[i].X) <= x
member.returns: The index of the bar closest to X, where max(bar[i].X) <= x.

member.summary: Defines the line cap type.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.LineCap.Butt
member.summary: Butt cap. The stroke is squared off at the endpoint of the path. There is no projection beyond the end of the path.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.LineCap.Round
member.summary: Round cap. A semicircular arc with a diameter equal to the line width is drawn around the endpoint and filled in.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.LineCap.ProjectingSquare
member.summary: Projecting square cap. The stroke continues beyond the endpoint of the path for a distance equal to half the line width and is squared off.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.PortableDocument.SetLineDashPattern(System.Double[],System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the line dash pattern.
member.param: The dash array specifies the lengths of alternating dashes and gaps; the numbers must be nonnegative and not all zero.
The dash phase specifies the distance into dash pattern at which to start the dash.
member.remarks: Before beginning to stroke a path, the dash array is cycled through, adding up the lengths of dashes and gaps. When the accumulated length equals the value specified by the dash phase, stroking of the path begins, and the dash array is used cyclically from that point onward. Table 4.6 shows examples of line dash patterns. As can be seen from the table, an empty dash array and zero phase can be used to restore the dash pattern to a solid line.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.PortableDocument.ResetLineDashPattern
member.summary: Resets the line dash pattern.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.PortableDocument.LineTo(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Appends a straight line segment to the current path.
member.remarks: Append a straight line segment from the current point to the point (x, y). The new current point is (x, y).

member.name: M:OxyPlot.PortableDocument.AppendCubicBezier(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Appends a cubic Bzier curve to the current path.
member.remarks: The curve extends from the current point to the point (x3 , y3 ), using (x1 , y1 ) and (x2 , y2 ) as the Bzier control points (see Cubic Bzier Curves, below). The new current point is (x3 , y3 ).

member.name: M:OxyPlot.PortableDocument.EndPath
member.summary: Ends the path.
member.remarks: End the path object without filling or stroking it. This operator is a path-painting no-op, used primarily for the side effect of changing the current clipping path (see Section 4.4.3, Clipping Path Operators).

member.name: M:OxyPlot.PortableDocument.CloseSubPath
member.summary: Closes the subpath.
member.remarks: Close the current subpath by appending a straight line segment from the current point to the starting point of the subpath. If the current subpath is already closed, h does nothing. This operator terminates the current subpath. Appending another segment to the current path begins a new subpath, even if the new segment begins at the endpoint reached by the h operation.

member.summary: Replaces the format items in the specified string.
member.remarks: The format string and values works as in String.Format. In addition, you can format properties of the item object by using the syntax {PropertyName:Formatstring}. E.g. if you have a "Value" property in your item's class, use "{Value:0.00}" to output the value with two digits. Note that this formatting is using reflection and does not have the same performance as string.Format.

member.name: T:OxyPlot.Conrec
member.summary: Provides functionality to create contours from a triangular mesh.

remarks.para: Ported from C / Fortran code by Paul Bourke. See Conrec for full description of code and the original source.

Contouring aids in visualizing three dimensional surfaces on a two dimensional medium (on paper or in this case a computer graphics screen). Two most common applications are displaying topological features of an area on a map or the air pressure on a weather map. In all cases some parameter is plotted as a function of two variables, the longitude and latitude or x and y axis. One problem with computer contouring is the process is usually CPU intensive and the algorithms often use advanced mathematical techniques making them susceptible to error.

member.name: T:OxyPlot.Conrec.RendererDelegate
member.summary: Renderer delegate

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Conrec.Contour(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],OxyPlot.Conrec.RendererDelegate)
member.summary: Contour is a contouring subroutine for rectangularily spaced data It emits calls to a line drawing subroutine supplied by the user which draws a contour map corresponding to data on a randomly spaced rectangular grid. The coordinates emitted are in the same units given in the x() and y() arrays. Any number of contour levels may be specified but they must be in order of increasing value.

member.summary: The null method, pixels are extracted sequentially from left to right, and scan lines sequentially from top to bottom.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.InterlaceMethod.Adam7
member.summary: Adam7, defines seven distinct passes over the image. Each pass transmits a subset of the pixels in the reference image. The pass in which each pixel is transmitted (numbered from 1 to 7) is defined by replicating a 8-by-8 pattern over the entire image, starting at the upper left corner.

member.name: T:OxyPlot.CanonicalCode
member.summary: A canonical Huffman code. Immutable. Code length 0 means no code.

remarks.p: The code is a c# port of the DEFLATE project by Nayuki Minase at github. Original source code: CircularDictionary.java.

A canonical Huffman code only describes the code length of each symbol. The codes can be reconstructed from this information. In this implementation, symbols with lower code lengths, breaking ties by lower symbols, are assigned lexicographically lower codes. Example: Code lengths (canonical code): Symbol A: 1 Symbol B: 3 Symbol C: 0 (no code) Symbol D: 2 Symbol E: 3 Huffman codes (generated from canonical code): Symbol A: 0 Symbol B: 110 Symbol C: None Symbol D: 10 Symbol E: 111

member.summary: Provides an abstract base class for elements that support selection.

member.summary: The selection

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: E:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the selected items is changed.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.Selectable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this element can be selected. The default is true.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.SelectionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the selection mode of items in this element. The default is SelectionMode.All.
member.remarks: This is only used by the select/unselect functionality, not by the rendering.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.ActualSelectedColor
member.summary: Gets the actual selection color.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.IsSelected
member.summary: Determines whether any part of this element is selected.
member.returns: true if this element is selected; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.GetSelectedItems
member.summary: Gets the indices of the selected items in this element.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.ClearSelection
member.summary: Clears the selection.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.Unselect
member.summary: Unselects all items in this element.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.IsItemSelected(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified item is selected.
member.returns: true if the item is selected; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.Select
member.summary: Selects all items in this element.

member.summary: Selects the specified item.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.UnselectItem(System.Int32)

member.name: M:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.GetSelectableColor(OxyPlot.OxyColor,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the selection color if the item is selected, or the specified color if it is not.
member.param: The unselected color of the element.
The index of the item to check (use -1 for all items).

member.name: M:OxyPlot.SelectableElement.GetSelectableFillColor(OxyPlot.OxyColor,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the selection fill color it the element is selected, or the specified fill color if it is not.
member.param: The unselected fill color of the element.
The index of the item to check (use -1 for all items).

member.summary: Ensures that the selection field is not null.
